On Value

Mar 1, 2016

Production of value

What you have bought or have not bought as well as the strength or persistence of your labor produces your identity in a capitalist soceity. Perceived value and currency value are intimately connected. The dollar store is junk, because everything is cheap. Good for you for making something out of that free trash: you wouldn’t be able to sell it anyway. It was worthless but you breathed value into it through your labor, or by buying things to alter it. You purchase your way into social roles. If you’re really lucky, you’ll throw that dingy free public school education out for a valuable private school education. Admire your collection of items purchased that show your interests. You’ve kept them in mint condition so they can, even just in theory, be sold for a profit.

Transparency

Capitalism thrives on opaque mechanisms?
